author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: إِلهِي كَبِّرْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَعَلَى الَّذِيْنَ طافُوْا فِي حَوْلِهِمْ فِي حَياتِهِمْ وَمَماتِهِمْ ثُمَّ ارْزُقْهُمْ ما قَدَّرْتَهُ لِخِيْرَةِ خَلْقِكَ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ الْمُقْتَدِرُ عَلَى ما تَشآءُ لا إِلهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ الْمُقْتَدِرُ الْمُهَيْمِنُ
translation: Proclaim, therefore, O my God, their greatness and the greatness of those who while living or after death have circled round them. Supply them with that which Thou hast ordained for the righteous among Thy creatures. Potent art Thou to do all things. There is no God but Thee, the All-Powerful, the Help in Peril, the Almighty, the Most Bountiful.
